projects.name: Determining the orbital periods of Jupiter's Galilean moons and verifying Kepler's 3rd law using a smartphone and the 6-inch telescope
projects.description: Employing similar tools, Aparajita and Pratik K. (Batch 23) determined the orbital periods of Jupiter's Galilean moons and verified Kepler's Third Law. Their meticulous approach was enhanced by Dr. G. Santosh B's guidance on error analysis.

projects.name: The Ballet of the Medicean Stars
projects.description: Our aim here was to find out the time-period of 4 bright moons of Jupiter (IO, Callisto, Ganymede, and Europa) on pure experimental background i.e., without using any theoretical knowledge. Further we also used the data to find the mass of Jupiter using some basic literature on the topic.

projects.name: Stellar Spectroscopy
projects.description: This was a semester-long experimental project aiming to design and build a dedicated spectrometer for NAC's own 11-inch CPC Deluxe 1100 HD telescope by using a diffraction grating and a planetary CMOS sensor.
